update.description:
Fixes blender generated collada files with actors with multiple skeletons.

Actors generated in blender have a root node called for the Armature in the library\_animation, however a root node called dummy-root is generated when parsing the library\_controller. Since they have different names they are not merged even though the Armature contains all the nodes parsed in the library\_controller.

This behavior resulted in duplicated bones being added to the mesh, which resulted in OGRE crashing and failing to spawn the models.

Note that there is a possible memory leak \(also present before this commit\) in MergeSkeleton when assigning a new value to the Skeleton root, since a new tree is assigned but the old one \(dynamically allocated with new\) is not deleted.

I have a few ideas how to fix it but for now left as a TODO for documentation.
update.title: Collada multiple skeletons

content.raw:
I put it into integration because my first thought was to go all the way to checking if the model was spawned correctly with OGRE but in the end “got lazy” and only tested the merge.

You have a good point, I had a look at the ColladaLoader unit tests and since they are also about making sure that collada meshes are loaded and processed correctly it sounds like that’s the best place to put it?

‌
content.html:

You have a good point, I had a look at the ColladaLoader unit tests and since they are also about making sure that collada meshes are loaded and processed correctly it sounds like that’s the best place to put it?

content.raw:
I suppose `test/integration/skeleton.cc` could be a "unit" test `graphics/src/Skeleton_TEST.cc`

even if it's not truly a unit test, it would match the other tests in the `graphics/src` folder
content.html:
I suppose test/integration/skeleton.cc could be a "unit" test graphics/src/Skeleton_TEST.cc

even if it's not truly a unit test, it would match the other tests in the graphics/src folder

content.raw:
Done! I created a very ugly cube with Blender and attached two skeletons to it, exported to collada and wrote a test to make sure the cube root name is correct \(and not dummy\).

Test fails with the custom\_paths\_uri branch but succeeds with this branch, as well as the model is spawned correctly in simulation with this patch but returns an error for duplicated bones without.

I’m really not happy with my CMake work, if you think there is a better way to include the graphics path and link to it feel free to update the PR!
content.html:
Done! I created a very ugly cube with Blender and attached two skeletons to it, exported to collada and wrote a test to make sure the cube root name is correct (and not dummy).

Test fails with the custom_paths_uri branch but succeeds with this branch, as well as the model is spawned correctly in simulation with this patch but returns an error for duplicated bones without.

I’m really not happy with my CMake work, if you think there is a better way to include the graphics path and link to it feel free to update the PR!

content.raw:
Works for me. It would just be nice to have a test case that exercises this use case.

I'm fine merging this as-is in case you want to work on the remaining improvements on a separate PR.
